Reviews.Title: “Sleepless Night”
Reviews.Author: p47r1ck
Reviews.Content: Travelling with work this hotel was chosen as it offered WiFi, advertised secure offsite parking @ £28 per night (advertised on website ) and had the Best Western brand. When I booked on line I expected an option to come up for the parking, but as it did not I phoned the hotel for assistance. The lady I spoke to did not know anything about the parking, nor did her colleagues, so I sought alternative parking options. When we arrived at the hotel, the reception is very nice, but the staff were a little unhelpful (but not rude). I checked into the room which was very small, although this is not a problem for me but may be for some. It was quite worn and in need of a refurb. I tried to use the WiFi but this did not work, and when I asked at reception was told there was nothing that could be done The major problem with this hotel was that it was impossible to sleep in the room I had. The room is next to the lift, which is very old and very loud. This creaked and clunked every time it was used. There is a youth hostel a couple of building down, which had revellers outside and in the park opposite all night. I have no problem with people enjoying themselves, however the single glazed window did nothing to prevent the noise. The bed was like sleeping on a sack of potatoes. It was worn, uneven and lumpy. I did ask at reception if there was another room available but unfortunately the hotel was apparently full. I did not get one minutes sleep. There are some plusses to the hotel. The rate was excellent @ £69 per night, and it is perfectly situated for the tube. However I feel the negatives outweigh the positives and it is not a hotel I will be using again, and I do not feel it is worthy of the Best Western Brand.

Reviews.Title: “cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: 186605Beachbum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Burns last weekend with three friends and all of us agree that it is a clean, cosy hotel. The single rooms are small but warm and cleaned to a high standard. The bathroom is small, functional and very clean. Our rooms overlooked the park at the front of the hotel and the birdsong in the (early) morning was a nice sound. A big fresh flower arrangement adorned the entrance hall, which adds a certain ambiance. The staff were helpful and we were able to store our luggage on our departure day. A nightcap can be enjoyed in the little quiet bar. So, a pleasant experience in a most convenient location. We all agreed we would stay again and the bonus was the very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For What You Pay”
Reviews.Author: Abbey2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in a quiet street just off Earls Court Road which has lots of good bars and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful and I did not experience any bad service like previous reviews. The room (62) was a standard double, not big, but fine for a night or two. Bathroom was ok too. Room was clean and quiet. Didn't use the restaurant, but did use the bar, which only sells bottled beer and was very quiet. Went out to locally pubs which were busy and fun. Booked the room about a month in advance and paid £60 room only from Otels.com (via their Facebook page which gives an extra 10% discount). For this price I can't fault it for a Central London hotel. I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: Myself and my colleagues were working at Earls court for 3 days so needed a convenient place to stay. We chose this hotel based on it's location, the only good thing about our booking. Everything else however was a disaster. 1. All three of us stayed in separate rooms and all had the exact same problem of "over used" uncomfortable and crunchy beds. 2. The rooms were very small. The bathrooms smelt damp and one of them only had a shower cubicle. 3. One of us had to stay in a basement room which smelt of smoke every time people had a cigarette by the hotel front doors. 4. The wi-fi is exceptionally weak proving very difficult to do any work in the evenings. 5. The hotel staff came across rude, un-interested in the customer or their own job satisfaction for that matter. 6. The breakfast was poor quality and very expensive, we ended up eating breakfast at a Gregg's cafe up the road. 7. All three of us had to have cold showers, even at 7am there seemed to be no hot water. 8. The lift was smaller than a phone box and we had to go to our rooms one at a time. 9. The door key cards kept loosing their data. 10. After seating for breakfast on the first morning we were then told to go and pay for our breakfast at the reception rather than adding it to our room. There were no signs saying this was the process before we checked in. 11. Very squeaky floorboards in ALL THREE rooms and what sounded like every other room. 12. The cold water is not even cold. I had to use bottled water to brush my teeth with. 13. Finally the basement room had bars on the windows, it was like a prison cell. This review is not exaggerated and I fail to see how there are 5 star ratings for this hotel. It certainly was not the same place that we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “A great fit for a leisure traveller!”
Reviews.Author: HomeinHouston
Reviews.Content: While I read some of the negative reviews before arriving, I made note to be somewhat critical of the hotel when I arrived so I could put a more accurate review. From the very beginning I will say, it was hard to find things unpleasant about this hotel. From the moment we arrived several hours before check-in the experience was nothing less than great! After reading some of the reviews about noise, I emailed a few weeks before arrival and requested 'one of their better rooms' and made note that we are light sleepers. When I arrived so early the staff let me know they could immediately accomodate my early arrival, but it would not be in a room type I had requested. As we were staying over a week, I opted to just leave my bags in hold and wait a few hours for the original room. After visiting the pub just steps away (The Blackbird) for a Full English and getting familiar with the GREAT AREA just a 1-2 minute walk from the tube, we returned and found a great room waiting for us - we stayed in room 104. Several of the complaints have been concerning business traveller amenities, and I will say upfront I did not get any impression of this being a business destination hotel. Although the Wi-Fi worked great in our room, I did hear several guests unhappy with the connections in their rooms. If you are on holiday, the need to sit in your room and surf the web shouldn't be a high priority as connections are available just down the street and several fast food chains and Starbucks for no charge. The floors do 'creak' as some of the other reviewers stated, but keep in mind you chose a Best Western to fit your budget, this is not a 5* hotel and the building is quite old - the sound is nothing I'm sure a pair of earplugs couldn't cancel. Even with 4 large bags between my wife and I the distance from the tube was easily managed. Earls Court tube stop is handicapped accesible so generally their is a lift available, although on our stay it was out. The location is ideal for tourists as their are so many things within a short walk, and the tube to see the rest of the main attractions. I can't say enough for the staff - they were beyond friendly and although through a thick Polish accent spoke great English. The breakfast is good, but if it's not included in the room charge I may have gone to the Blackbird, as the food was just the same for a lesser price. I honestly can not say enough great things about this place! Feel free to message me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerEM13
Reviews.Content: Good location for amenities. Single room on 3rd floor was a good size with a good sized bathroom too. Room, linen and towels very clean though net curtains had seen better days. Bed was soft but ok for the one night I stayed. I did not have the breakfast so cannot comment on this but overall a good hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: UndertoneShropshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed 15/16 December. We went to see "Mama Mia" and the Horse Show at Olympia. Great location near Earls Court Tube. Which means you can get anywhere in central London quickly. Also walked to Chelsea High Street (Sloane Sq)Kensington High Street and Olympia. Public areas and the staff are very good. Our room however was'nt too big with a shower not a bath. It also looked like it needed a big of a refurb but was clean and quiet. Would use again at right price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda120663
Reviews.Content: My I start by saying that I have stayed here every December for the weekend for the last 5 years and I am fed up with the bad reviews the hotel gets! The hotel is an old Victorian building and thus must be respected as so. The rooms are clean, comfortable and a reasonable size. The Bathrooms have the expected products you need and the room itself the usual hospitality tray. The staff are smiling, friendly and helpful. Our cleaner for the room was lovely I even left her a tip! I had booked 2 rooms for 2 nights both Bed and full English Breakfast. One booking had the full English missed off. Not a problem it was adjusted back on immediately. Just a note: if you book a full English you can have as much of the Continental breakfast as you want too! People have varying ideas of 3* please be realistic and remember if you really mean 5* them put your hand in your pocket and pay for it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, no wifi, facility far from 3 star”
Reviews.Author: EvertonianSunny
Reviews.Content: Okay the location is indeed great. Earl's Court is both zone 1 and zone 2 and it's both cheap and fast to get there from heathrow airport by Piccadilly tube line, or a short walk from the Easybus stop from Getwick. Now, it say its a three star hotel. I booked 5 nights through booking.com with an average rate of about 100 GBP. The prime reason I choose this hotel among others in this area is that it offers free wifi, and of course, the brand name gives some guarantee, I thought. These are not so. In fact, this is an "independently owned and operated hotel" (as it posted on the front door) which somehow bears the Best Western label, through some licencing agreement, I guess. I am surprised the receptionist greets me was not quite fluent in English. Okay, we get our room, while it is a VIctorian house, I did not expect it takes a very narrow corridor and about 10 steps before reaching my room. Okay, we are young, we can walk a bit despite the large suitcases plus hand carrys we carried. Into the room. It is small (okay, it's London), smaller than some B&B I used to stay in London. The wardrobe is a laugh - It is about only 1.5' wide and can hold about 2 coats and a pair of shirt. There is a safe in it - but it charges you GBP2 per day to use - which, to me, is unacceptable for a 3-star hotel room costs 100 GBP per night. Then, there is no fridge in the room! Even some B&B in London equip with a fridge! The bed is a small 6'x4' and is rather small considered it a double room. To sum up, the room is merely a B&B with a Best Western label so that it can charge a overprice. Then, it comes to another nightmare of the room - the wifi. And this is the prime reason why I say service is poor in the title. The free wifi offered is a joke (as in some previous posts pointed out). It was very weak in our room (1/5 to 2/5 in all the 2 phones and a notebook computer we used). And it takes like 15-30 minutes just to connect to the signal. When we finally goes through, type in the password, it just comes off every 5 or 10 minutes. When we complained this, the receptionist first offered to reset the router for us. Then, it works for a few hours. The next morning, the same issue came again. We asked for a reset of router again and it worked again. We didn't know how long it lasted as we checked our message and left our room. In the evening, the signal was dead again. When we asked for a reset of router, this time, the staff refused. Perhaps she thought we are troublesome but his explanation was that there were many customers connected and we were the only one making complaint. Then, I asked if it was because we lived from a blind spot of wifi signal. Then, she immediately said that the router was in fact very close to our room! She asked us to go to the reception at ground floor, where she claimed the signal strongest (despite the router being close to our room and the reception is quite a few rooms away and a floor down) connect there and go back to our room. In fact we tried and I didn't work - the signal is weak even at the reception and unconnectable. Then, when we ask if we can change our room, where other many people has connected to the wifi as she claims, she vaguely claimed the signal is the same everywhere in the hotel (despite her earlier claim that the siganl is either strongest in our room or down in the reception). After I insist, she offer a change of a room the same block, one floor above us on the next day. And finally they could reset the router then, which "many customers have connected". On the next day, a senior member of staff told us that in fact the router of the block we stayed had problems and they had arranged maintenance. They offered us a room in the other block. Once there, the wifi was working well (albeit still a bit unstable). Apart from the unability to use wifi in the first three days of stay where we stay in our first room (which we have paid for including the wifi), the service is poor. They simply refuse to face and address to our needs. Poor service, poor room. I would recommend you staying in other hotels, which are many in the area.

Reviews.Title: “What a super place”
Reviews.Author: sg3013
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I have visited London almost twice a year since about ten years whitout ever hearing anything about this hotel. We booked it trough a package deal (something I have never tried before either) and were amazed of the many advantages this hotel presents: It is located 2mins walk from the tube station Earls Court, were you can catch the Picadilly, Circle and District Line. This means it is only around 40 mins from Heathrow and like 15 Mins to oxford street. the neighbourhood is fun but safe. The hotel also serves a decent continental buffet breakfast. On weekends even until 11.30 PM. And the staff is just extremly friendly. They would never rush you out of the breakfast zone, even the breakfast times are long over. The rooms are clean and realy quiet. The size, is what you can expect from a hotel in London. I would say, this is definetely one of the best places to stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: shaun1968red
Reviews.Content: From the outside, it looks like an old building, but as soon as you enter the building it looks great as everywhere is tidy, clean and very spacious. I even arrived at the Hotel early and they allowed me to book into the room early, which straight away made me think what good customer service. I had booked a single room ,so it was on the fourth floor but they do have a lift. When I entered my room I was surprised at the size but it was admittedly just enough for me and the Bathroom was great. Shower or bath was available. Very quiet at night aswell. The breakfast was very good aswell, you can have what you like. English or Continental(English breakfast extra). I would go back again as its not far from the West End as Earls Court underground station is at the end of the road. Taxi fare if decide to stay in London late is £16 after midnight back to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “don't listen to bad reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anna l
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel for us as a surprise.The hotel was very nice.Close to all pubs and restaurants ,and to the shops.Our room wasn't very big but was alright,bathroom was very clean.The staff were very friendly and nice with smiles on their faces.We had continental breakfast included but we could upgrade to an English breakfast for just £3 extra!!Breakfast Staff (all of them) was very nice and friendly and we never saw anyone upset or grumpy as you can read in other reviews. We enjoyed our stay and next time we are in London we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mysted
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week for a business trip, the hotel need a serious refurbishment. The room was very small and old. There is no fridge in the room and the staffs are not helpful, they don't know the street parking regulations and they suggested to park the car at HolidayInn, Ibis, or Crown Hotel parking areas which are not very close the hotel. It is possible to find a better hotel for the same price at Paddington which is more close to the city center and to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: herdy94
Reviews.Content: A lovely friendly hotel all the staff were ready to help at anytime good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Over priced in London but a good location”
Reviews.Author: FailteEire
Reviews.Content: Great location within 5 minutes walk to Earl's Court Tube station, so a direct link by tube to Heathrow Airport. As for most of London this hotel is overpriced for the accommodation provided. Rooms vary from very very small to medium size. Sleep quality is 1/10 as there is little or no sound proofing. However, it is located on a relatively quite street. Some good local restaurants and pubs.

Reviews.Title: “good place bad service”
Reviews.Author: afshan m
Reviews.Content: Negatives • When I called to confirm I had requested a free upgrade but was told it wasn’t possible till I got there. I did inform them that I would be an early check in. When I arrived, I was told that I could get an upgrade but it would take another hour to 2 hours. Not what I wanted to hear after a 10 hour flight. They did have space to keep my luggage while I went out and stretched my legs. The room was ready in an hour and a half. • keep in mind that Local calls are charged too • No pen in the room, just a blunt pencil • Connection in the kettle was loose. I had to stand and hold the chord in. • I had requested a wakeup call on all 3 days but didn’t get one on day 2 and almost missed my tour. • Window doesn't open fully in room 401. • I got a fan when i requested one, however it made so much noise that i didnt end up using it • No bell boy. I had to lug 2 large suitcases and a handcarry to the 4th floor by myself. The staff didn’t even offer to help. To top it off the elevators are tiny so had to make 3 trips. It was not pleasant. • There was Mould on the tub. Along the edges near the wall. The shower faucet was also finicky. • Wifi was horrible. It kept disconnecting every 5 minutes and there were no bars for the signal in my room. • Room was too small. Ive been told since that the rooms are generally smaller but there was barely enuff space for my luggage. • My room was facing the main street and I barely slept the first night (Friday night) beaucse of the noise from the street below. positives • Checkout service was smooth and correct. But I still got no help with my luggage. • They have Great shampoo. • Bed was comfortable n pillows were great. • The Laundry service was great. I gave my clothes in the morning and they were available by 7pm. • 3 min walk to the train station so very convenient that way.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better but good for 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: Pirate_Sparrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two days. We got a room in the basement, which was not so pleasant. The room seemed very old. We also had two separate beds, which we do not beviel.De staff was all right and were friendly. The breakfast was simple but good. All in all we enjoyed England!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places out there, not recommended if you have high standards”
Reviews.Author: Garyok
Reviews.Content: A tired and overused hotel with a lack of identity. The place feels sad and depressing and the staff seem bored and disinterested. It may be cheap but there must be nicer places around?

Reviews.Title: “Basil...!”
Reviews.Author: jonathancollins
Reviews.Content: What can I say... This hotel should be called Best Western Faulty Towers! I stayed here with a colleague on business. I booked it based on some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, and I do have to question if the hotel has put these on, as they are so far off the mark, apart from the location. I stayed on the first floor, in a double (box) room. It is the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in, and just felt so claustrophobic. My colleague stayed in the basement in a twin room, which was far more spacious, but had no ventilation in the bathroom, so it stunk of damp. Our room keys kept losing their data, so we had to keep going to reception to get them reset, which seemed to be a regular occurrence as I saw a few people having the same issue. The reception staff just gave the stock answer... "Your key must have been near your phone". Had a drink in the bar the first evening... the beer was warm. The highlight of the stay however has to be the breakfast experience... The first morning we sat down, and before my bum had sat on the seat we were being asked what we wanted from the menu, and aggressively so. Give me chance to sit down and look at what you offer first hey! The 2nd day was the same, however after 30 minutes of waiting we gave up and left as we needed to get to a meeting. There was no point chasing said breakfast as a Scottish man was already doing this with no joy. Overall, awful hotel, awful service, awful rooms, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Luckydog889
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Burns for 6 days in Sept. 2011. We were looking for a reasonable rate, and a good location. A rate of 130 pounds per night is reasonable in London. It turned out to be a great location. IT seemed like a very safe area. Other tourists we met were staying in areas they thought were a little unsettling. It is on the Tube line from Heaithrow and it is on the Picadilly and District lines into town. It is about 5 minute walk to the station, and there are several resturants and shops on the street in front of the station, which is Earl's Court. The hotel itself is fine. The back rooms are quiet, there is a lift. We did not have a reservation that included breakfast, so we don't know how the breakfast was. We ate at the Blackbird pub, and they have a great breakfast. In fact you can split a single full english breakfast. They also have good evening meals. That is good, by pub standards, which tend to be rather simple.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_B_02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days at the end of September with my wife. Would Not recommend staying here if you're a party of more than one person. Room was very, very small. We could barely open the door because the bed was in the way. Did not have washcloths. Room seemed old, in need of renovation, stain in the shower and dusty in a strange nook by the shower. Small shower, even by European standards (rooms are generally smaller in Europe by American standards). Fortunately we did not pay full price of 120p a night, only 90. Still probably not worth it. We saw cheaper prices earlier but were unable to book until later. You can do better in London in the same price point and a similar location. Was a minute walk to Earl's Court tube station, its one fill redeeming quality.

Reviews.Title: “They don't need your business and it shows”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScribe
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't care less about encouraging repeat business and a return visit showed just how little they really care about their guests. On the strength of the lovely room I had at this hotel last year, I booked again for a week's stay, this time with my husband. I asked for the same room or one equivalent to it and was assured that I would get one. However, instead of a large high-ceilinged room, nicely fitted out, and with bay windows overlooking the square, we got a small, cramped dark room down an inconvenient short flight of stairs at the rear with small windows, no view and basic furniture (for the same price). To add insult to injury, every time we went in or out of our room during the day we had to struggle past the unappealing sight of piled up dirty sheets from the other rooms which were left in the short walkway to our room and we had to avoid tripping over the vacuum cleaner which was also always stored there. We were obviously of little interest to the hotel as repeat visitors and were given what was surely the worst room in the place. Having not wanted to start our trip (which was actually a special occasion trip for us) with complaints, I didn't say anything on the first day but by day 3 we were very fed up with the dirty washing we had to edge past and made a complaint. We were told this would change but all that happened was that the washing was stored in a large laundry bin on the way to our room. Trying to use the bar one evening for a quiet drink, my husband ordered a beer but found the blaring television very intrusive and asked the young woman working there if she would mind turning it down...even the adverts were played at full blast. Nothing happened. At the second time of asking, she couldn't even be bothered to swivel her head from what was obviously her favourite program but just snapped that she had turned it down. Fed up with adverts for hair products etc, my husband gave up and left. Staff serving in the breakfast room showed little idea of what might be pleasant for the guest rather than the easiest for them, always attempting to squeeze us into the rather odd tables in the first room (which tilt up towards you so that drinks, cereals etc flow downwards to the centre) rather than suggesting the more spacious area in the conservatory. You have to be firm and insist on finding your own table. This hotel gets business people attending Earls Court & Olympia exhibitions & conventions etc and is apparently also listed on some package tours. As a result, it appears to run very close to full capacity. Unfortunately this means they couldn't care less about the experience they are delivering and guest satisfaction is at the bottom of their list of priorities. I always hope to find a hotel I can go back to for my regular London trips (2-3 times a year) but it definitely won't be this one.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and affordable”
Reviews.Author: KushanMitra
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after reading the reviews on this site incidentally, and I must admit I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are quite basic, but I got one facing the park and it was quite breezy. While not 'cheap' given the location next to Earl's Court station and the Natural History and V&A Museums it is actually not a bad deal at all. Breakfast, which was part of the package I took was wholesome and I did grab a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Epicure30
Reviews.Content: The Burns is not an North American hotel with all the room inside, it is a London hotel who has to deal with the room it has. that being, it is a well kept hotel, safe and secure. the personnel is charming and will attend to your needs. the full english breakfast is as good as they come. It is CLEAN, charming and the inner garden is great. I give it five stars because of the price, personnel and food. It is not the RITZ but if you an afford it you would be reading this review, your BUTLER would. Seriously folks, I have been to those tourist things in Russel SQ. and believe me this is GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: newt4457
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my partner and child in a family room. The hotel is situated just 5 minutes walk from Earls Court tube station and has pubs, eateries and cash points within the same walking distance. We all thought the room was great. It was a good size, very clean and with a great shower. We were on the third floor and there was surprisingly little noise from outside. The lift up is quite small and slow but we all managed to squeeze in and I'm never in a rush on holiday. Found all the staff to be very pleasant. There is a nice little bar area which is open until midnight. Its a bit expensive, but then most hotel bars are. Breakfast was fine without being startling, the service was good and it was very clean. Just a couple of negative's . I asked for an early morning call every day . Once it was an hour early and once it didn't happen. One morning they had no bacon, I understand that occasionally deliveries mess up but I ask the question. Did they do everything in their power to give the customer what they wanted and had paid for? Well, no they didn't. They could have nipped out and bought some. It's not as if the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. In truth I wasn't that bothered (I think I was in holiday mode) but worth mentioning I think. One other thing that I didnt think that was very good was the use of the hotels computer & internet at £1 for 20 mins. Other hotels that I have stopped at (Including BW) have been free. I had my laptop and its free. In summary. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here, as did my partner and would have no hesitation in stopping again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not a good value”
Reviews.Author: wchurch
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with Burns and it is a good place to stay but definitely not a good value in Earls Court. There are hotels within 300 meters that are 30 GBPs a night cheaper, just as clean, some with bigger beds, and some with better or equal free breakfast. About the only negative is that it is a larger hotel without central air. It is not about temperature but about air movement so the hotel is stuffy and humid on bad London days. They also lock down the windows so they can only be open a little bit. Had to laugh at the internet description, pushing the fact they are in up market Kensington (technically true) but in fact they are in Earl Court which is a much better tube stop. I was stuck this week and my usual 65 GBP hotel booked. Will only stay here again if I get stuck again on a last minute trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Crap and i will NOT BE BACK.”
Reviews.Author: vvarmy
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. check meaning of Hotel ??? this is a b&b. were did thay get 3 stars from.????? i an 62 and was in room 212 if there was a fire on that floor do i jump from the window to the back yard ???? DO NOT STAY AT THIS B&B.The staff do not want to know you are there. DO NOT STAY HERE. you have been warned. Our room as so small. and price high.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: jansarb
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel, dirty, falling apart, threadbare carpets, the room was disgusting and the breakfast was awful. We could not understand the staff as they always spoke in a foreign language. The only good thing about this place was that it was close to a food shop so we could get something decent to eat after breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice home during our visit to london”
Reviews.Author: sabine_coussement
Reviews.Content: Decided on this hotel through our travel agency JETAIR after several of our previous choices appeared fully booked. Now realise that a choice for this hotel at the edge of tubezone 1 was the best one we could ever make. The tube entrance was 500 m from the doorstep. Nice neighbourhood to walk through, even late in the evening. We got 2 rooms at the backside of the hotel: though rather small, they were perfectly quiet and coffee and tea facilities were daily completed. The water boiler was perfectly clean!! (we've seen it differently elsewhere). The rooms themselves indeed had cracking floors and the carpet could be cleaner, but we always bring our own slippers to wear in the room. The bathroom was rather tiny, but very clean, and anough shower gel/shampoo etc was always available. Staff at the reception desk were very friendly and extremely helpful (we could even leave our luggage in a cloakroom upon our arrival, so we didn't have to bother about them during our first afternoon in London). The waitresses in the breakfast room though were apparently not always enjoying their job, we believe there should be better coordination between them instead of competition (that's what it looked like). Breakfast buffet (continental) was satisfying, enough food and choice. This definitely is a hotel to come back to, if ever we want to visit London again.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay there”
Reviews.Author: Maurice W
Reviews.Content: Were booked for 4 nights but upon arrival were offered single beds.when we had requested double. No compromise was given-take it or leave it or contact our travel agent (3 am in the morning in our part of the world) We didnt even enter the bed room but told them that we were leaving and asked for our prepaid voucher back .No effort was made to stop us and we found the staff to be most unhelpful and more interested in other incoming clients. The lift was scary and almost malfunctioning. An excellent alternative was found around the corner and the staff were most helpful. Our agent had to wear the costs for at least three of the four night that we had booked. We would never recommend this place to anyone in fact would discourage them. What a great start to our tour of England!! Fortunately this glitch didnt deter from the wonderful time that we had after that.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: poettraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Burns Hotel and it was an average stay in an average hotel. They did let us check in early on our first day so that was nice. Other than that, the staff was adequate, the rooms were small but not uncomfortable and the bathrooms were very small, but that's to be expected here. We did like the location - very near to underground and we were able to move about the city easily. We ate breakfast in the hotel each morning and they had lots of the usual foods offered. I thought they had good porridge! Really, nothing special here, but nothing to complain about either.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: aussiemiss
Reviews.Content: I had a comfortable stay at the Best Western Burns hotel, which is excellently located near the Earls Court tube station. My single bed room was not too small, clean and nicely furnished. The staff were reasonably helpful and friendly. There is no fridge or minibar or airconditioning and for the price there are better value hotels in the Earls court area. Overall I had a pleasant stay at this hotel, and I think Earls Court is a good area of London.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Connie080 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with friendly helpful staff. The room we had was very small and on the lower ground floor so there was no view from the window, but we were only sleeping there. More importantly, the room was clean and tidy and I felt safe staying there with my 11 year old daughter. Good location with easy access to Earls Court tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: cnlbotts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights. The lift kinda works but I would suggest the stairs. It only fits about 2 people and works sometimes. My husband and I were given 2 single beds on the bottom floor. The room was tiny but we had been warned about small hotel rooms in Europe. The toilet did not work well and on the second night completely backed up. They were unable to fix it and had to use the lobby. On the third night while watching TV in bed we saw a mouse running around. We immediately contacted reception to be told there is nothing they could do that night but to see them the next morning. The next morning we were given a new room on a higher floor. This room was much nicer and had been recently renovated. If we had of been given this room from the start our stay would have been much better and might consider staying again. Upside to the hotel was the location. Easy to get around by the underground tube and close to the station. The pub on the corner is not worth the money and try elsewhere. There is a laundry mat close by.

Reviews.Title: “Single Rooms :-( Not the best”
Reviews.Author: woodruffjones
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for one night during June. I wasnt aware that this hotel provided single beds otherwise I would not have booked. The hotel its self has a quaint feel to it and is in an excellent location for tourists only a hop skip to the tube station. However the room was very dissapointing, I stayed on the Lower Ground floor and my bedroom backed ont a small courtyard at the rear. The bed was uncomfortable and I was woken at 5.30am with noise comng from the Kitchen, I presume they were preparing for breakfast. The head of the bed was right next to the door which led on to the hallway so there was constant noise. It was not a very comfortable nights sleep. if you can stay in another room or floor I would do so. Continental breakfast was fine nothing to go wrong really. Overall not the best night I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DawnLouiseAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and it was great. Therefore we decided to stay again twice during this trip. However, it has deteriorated. You can not fault the location. However, our room was very dirty (wont go into the details) when we arrived and it didn't improve once our room had been serviced. We had to try and clean the filthy floor ourselves. The floor boards in the floor are very loose and very noisy, therefore you can hear the people in rooms either side and upstairs. We were kept awake during the night on several occasions because of people in the other rooms returning late and walking over the floor boards. They were sort of problematic last time but they were definately worse this time round (can't they fix them??). With a few exceptions, the hotel staff in general were unfriendly and looked as though they really didn't want to be there (can't say I blame them). They were not even interested in how your stay was when you left. We were very disappointed because we thought highly of the place. As a result I would not stay again :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for its price range.”
Reviews.Author: pinkpanther52
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend on a Trip to Wimbledon Tennis. Hotel is perfectly situated at just a few min walk from Earls Court tube station but on a quiet leafy side street. Asked for aroom at the Front of the hotel and got a large (for London) room over looking leafy garden AND windows that open - It is one of my pet hates to stay in a room with non opening windows. This is not a modern and trendy Hotel but in a traditional buildin so all the rooms are going to be different. Breakfast was very good. Did not have the cooked brekfast but I could see this was freshly cooked AND Served to you. Only critisem was the public ares were a tad warm. All in all I would go back to this hotel any time I was in London.

Reviews.Title: “Some nice things to say but...”
Reviews.Author: belindascotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a long weekend in London. I had booked through a website, not through the hotel or through Best Western. I stay in Best Western Hotels a lot for work, and the standard is always excellent with lovely rooms. So I was dismayed with our room on the lower ground floor. The room itself was OK but it looked out onto a dismal courtyard which contained two sad looking pot plants, four mops and a discarded tea urn. I cringed to think what tourists from abroad would think of it. ( In fact this courtyard could be made into something really nice with a bit of imagination.) I got straight onto the phone and complained about the room. I was told they could not move us that night because the hotel was full, but if we packed our cases they would move us to a better room the next morning. The next room was very nice with a view out over the gardens so we were very happy. The continental breakfast was OK and the staff were pleasant. The decor in the hotel is a bit tired in places but overall it's clean and pleasant. There is a nice garden at the back and a little bar also at the rear of the hotel. The hotel is in a nice area and is very close to Earls Court tube station so it is very handy for getting to Central London and good for getting to Heathrow Airport. I would say for the area it is good value. I felt very let down by the first room we were give. The owners might like to reflect that being put in a room with such a miserable outlook puts an immediate damper on a holiday. However I give them 10 out of 10 for dealing with my complaint in a very satisfactory way.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with uninspired service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Best Western Burns Hotel. I found out I had to go to London fairly late so did not have a lot of options but this seemed ok. The location is fairly convenient, it is very near Earl's court station (exit towards Earl's Court Road and then just a few minutes walk). The area may not be the most fun part of London but easy access to both Heathrow and the central parts of London. From the outside the hotel looks like he other hotels lining many of the streets in this area. Upon entering there is a fairly small lobby, when I arrived there were several people there and it easily gets crowded and chaotic. Check-in was very slow, the staff were friendly but it took ages for them to help people so was a too long wait to be ok. The hotel does not have a very modern feel to it, taking the elevator to my room on the third floor it felt as if it could stop at any time. Entering the room was a disappointment, even though I did not have high expectations. The room was small which is to be expected and it was bigger than a few other Best Western hotels in the same area I previously stayed at. The furniture did however appear to be older than I and it just looked horrible (see pictures). The bed was small and too soft. Desk was ugly but functional. The room did have a water kettle, free coffee/tea, fairly new flat screen TV and free wifi. Use of the safe would however cost £2 per day, not really a nice surprise. The room further lack a/c, now it was just on the verge of being too hot but could probably be awful on really hot summer days. The bathroom have a cheap plastic feel to, low water pressure in both shower and sink. The bathroom as well as the rest of the room was however clean but it did have the really cheap budget feel so while decently functional (except for the water pressure) it is not very nice. Did not have breakfast or eat anything in the restaurant so cannot comment on the food at the hotel. Looking at the price I paid for the room it was however not good value (granted it was a late booking during what at appeared to be a busy period in London). There are better options for much lower prices (or excellent places for the same money)

Reviews.Title: “dont eat in the bar”
Reviews.Author: amy_plaisted
Reviews.Content: i'm not normally fussy about where i stay but travelling on my own - i dont really want to venture out late. So i prefer to eat in the hotels notmally, the 'bar' menu which is also the restaurant menu, wa pretty poor - most things fried, so i went for brie with raspberry sauce and greek salad. both were hideous. Brie with raspberry sauce was deep fired cheese bits with 2x raspberry jam from the breakfast condiments dumped on the side... salad - iceburg, cucumber x2 and a tomato slice and some cheap bottled italian dressing. (trust me i am not a expert, or a fussy eater!!) Main course was the same salad - iceberg, cue and tomator - olives from the bar - feta cheese and that same dressing... vile..... i have never written a review before, but if someone had - i wold stopped off at the Nados or the M&S food for a sarnie and bag of crisps... really poor... the room is clean and tidy, but very hot as there is no aircon and its July - not hot but very humid...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: OSnell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Burns Hotel in Earls Court for 4 nights as part of a block booking for an exhibition. The Burns is well located for the Earls Court exhibition centre (easy walk) and local pubs and restaurants (very short walk). The hotel is situated in a nice building and is clean and well presented with friendly staff. The room rate we got for a 3 - 4 night stay was £95 per single room inclusive full English breakfast (good!), which is reasonable for a centrally located hotel in London. The rooms are quite small, which seems to be typical for this part of town. People we spoke to at the exhibition who had paid less at other hotels seemed to have considerably less space. My room was a bit noisy - next door's bathroom appeared to have no sound insulation at all and the big gap at the bottom of the door let in noise from passing guests (solved at night by rolling up the bath mat and placing by the door). I also found the room to be too warm, the building obviously soaking up the sun during the day and not cooling down much at night. The wi-fi was flaky at peak times, but was included in the room rate and good once connected. I enjoyed my stay at the Burns and would recommend it to others. I would rate it overall at 3.5 stars if given the option, but 4 is too many.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: rocksy25
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Burns is situated in Earls' Court, only a mere 200m from the tube station. Decent place with no fancy beds or interior decorations. Average breakfast. Down the street there are 2 or 3 pubs, very good. A M&S Food is right next to the tube station and a Tesco further along Cromwell Road, some 600meters. Free WiFi is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Handy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: vincec
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cllose to Earls Court Tube and makes getting around very simple. The staff are friendly and our room 314 clean and spacious by London standards. The breakfast was fine and good to have it served fresh rather than self service from a dried out buffet. The lift is small and slow but is that such a big issue to be mentioned so often on here. Good value, comfortable and friendly. Suits me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel altogether”
Reviews.Author: tatami71
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable rooms. There is a pub in the hotel, which is small but nice too. We had to pay breakfast in a separate invoice, which was not very nice. The breakfast is not very rich though. Internet pc does not work well. Altogether we enjoyed staying at Best Western Burns Hotel. The location is very central and good, which is a plus to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING FANCY , BUT REASONABLE”
Reviews.Author: kitkats11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our UK trip. We stayed at the Burn Hotel 3 nights. The GOOD: It is easy to find, just a block from Earls court tube station. Lot's of c-stores and food rear by. The hotel is old as are most buildings in the London are.The room was clean and the satff helpfull. THE BAD: The rooms are small, The elevators are tiny, the beds are in need of replacing, feeling coil springs all night !. , No vent in the bathroom, the window is blocked open all the time. makes for cold nights and showers. For london it is a economy hotel for $ 250.00 USD per night. TIPS: Exchange only what you need for money to get to your hotel at the airport exchange booths, about 50.00 USD. Use ATM'S for your spending cash, much less cost and a fair exchange. Becareful crossing the street, ALWAYS LOOK RIGHT FIRST. UK drivers WILL NOT STOP if you jay walk. Take 2 credit/debit cards and a fist full of cash, you will need it. Everything is almost 2 times the cost here in America and you get 1/2 the quality or quanity. Happy trails , Ken in Wisconsin -GKKBAR@CHARTER.NET

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place, frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: MarlaToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is handy to everything, reasonably priced, clean with friendly staff, BUT on two occasions (a Saturday and Sunday nights) we arrived back to our hotel, exhausted, ready for a nice meal only to discover that dining room was closed - NO notice given. The Saturday evening the room was booked but we asked for room service and were told "No." and the following evening we arrived back to find the dining room was simply closed. There were pubs in the area - and a Burger King! - but we were tired and were looking forward to a nice meal. We felt that for a Best Western this was an unforgiveable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, coming back again”
Reviews.Author: catinthehat8
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here, will be coming back. Rooms were reasonably priced, especially for London and it was no trouble getting there by tube. Especially enjoyed the breakfast they provided, it was served fresh, quickly and with obvious care! Service was fantastic, they could do nothing more for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good part : hotel in zone 1 - Bad part : Old building and a little untidy rooms”
Reviews.Author: alex_sho1986
Reviews.Content: -2 minutes far away from the underground station (Earl's Court) -a hotel in zone 1 of London, saves you a lot of time getting to the city center -good food -good rates -good neighborhood -small room -old building -not so clean -we found a bug in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Good location - horrbile interior”
Reviews.Author: Becs005
Reviews.Content: I stayed here April 17-22, 2011. It was within perfect walking distance to the tube and Earls Court Exhibition Centre, but was awful in terms of accomodations. It was very warm that week and the hotel operates on central heat, indvidual room s only have raditors for heat - not air conditioning. I was on the first floor facing the road and therefore could not open my windows to cool off the room. The room was spacious however, the occupant of the home next door likes to sing the same off key song late into the evening - daily. The free Internet was spotty, so don't count on that as an added feature. I would not recommend staying here, there are a bunch of hotels within this area - check one of them out instead.

Reviews.Title: “THEFT FROM ROOM”
Reviews.Author: kickass_cutie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Burns hotel from the 14th to the 17th of april. During my stay my iPod was stolen from my room. There's nothing else to say really!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for London but...”
Reviews.Author: ladyarm
Reviews.Content: The location is what this place has going for. A few blocks from the tube and lots of good restaurants neary cannot be beat. However, beware the hotel is dated and the room so tiny you could barely turn around.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but great location”
Reviews.Author: joy33003
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel based on location which is brilliant for sightseeing -so near the underground in a safe area. The twin room we had was so tiny we had to close the bathroom door to get around the bed. Rooms clean and adequate otherwise. We ate in the bar on the first night as exhausted - would not recommend - very poor standard. Continental breakfast OK - dont bother with the full English which is an extra charge - not the best quality sausages and bacon. I would still stay here again purely for the location if the price was right but would would not share a room or eat in. I would highly recommend a visit to Hampton Court when in London. Superb.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but served their purpose”
Reviews.Author: 23stationroad Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We expected small rooms as this hotel is in London but the rooms were clean, warm and just what we needed

Reviews.Title: “Creaky floorboards but acceptable.... brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Marty1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights having a double room on the 4th floor. This hotel is in a great location just a very short walk to Earls Court tube and lots of restaurants/bars. The lifts are very small and slow. The room was small but clean. There were creaky floorboards which could annoy! The TV was wall mounted and had all the Freeview channels- a little bonus. Some areas of the hotel do look a little tired but there seems to be a bit of refurbishment going on. The continental breakfast was pretty good and staff throughout were generally very helpful. We paid £160 so we were well pleased for that... I wouldn't want to pay more though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: This is a basic budget hotel with a great location. Only a few steps from the Earls Court tube station this property is surrounded with pubs, newsagents, grocers, takeaways and everything you could need. Very easy access to LHR. The elevators are small and at least one was out of order during my visit. I had a single room on the top floor with a beautiful view of the square. The floors were very loud and creaky so I would not want to have anyone above me. There was no alarm clock so you needed to figure out how to program the television for wakeups. The bed was old and not very comfortable but the local phone usage was very affordable. The one time I tried to use the restaurant it was out of the most basic items. I could never get the wifi to work despite repeated attempts by staff to help. Overall a decent budget hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Tad02
Reviews.Content: Although the room was a bit shabby, the mattresses rather hard, and the staff somewhat indifferent, this hotel was super clean, in a very nice neighborhood and ideally located. It's a very short walk to shops/restaurants and the Earl's Court tube station is less than 5 minutes away. The hotel is on a side street off Earl's Court Rd, facing a gated park, so street noise is minimal. Our room was at the back of the hotel (even quieter) and we had a pleasant view of neighboring gardens. Our window even opened which was good because the room was quite hot. We got a good price on the room, so although I'd have to rate the hotel overall as average, we were pleased with it for our one week stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “You know the London hotel from "European Vacation"?”
Reviews.Author: Bon_voyage79
Reviews.Content: Well, that pretty much sums up the experience. This was my second time here, and I'm not sure what I was thinking the first time that compelled me to think that it was good quality. That said, I do think our room was of worse quality this time around. So, yeah, it's pretty much like the hotel that the Griswolds ended up with...the beds were more than "a little soft" - you could practically feel the springs under your back and had to be careful to not move while sleeping. The room was SO dilapidated. Everything was falling apart. It was disgusting. It was hard to tell what was dirt and what was just a perma stain. There appeared to be a bougar on the wall. GAG. The TV was in an awkward place so that neither bed could clearly see it. The room was covered in mirrors, and I think it was so that you could watch the reflection of the TV even if you couldn't see the actual TV. The only good thing about this hotel is its location in Earl's Court. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - in a quiet leafy square yet very near underground”
Reviews.Author: Doctor99
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at this hotel. I specifically asked for a quietly located room and got it. All the staff were unfailingly polite, helpful and friendly. The location is lovely - walking distance to the V & A Museum, and a minute from the Earl's Court underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,lovely staff, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: luckymark2
Reviews.Content: My sister, adult daughter and I are just home today from a 3 night stay in Burns hotel. We found it perfect for our needs. The rooms are compact and spotlessly clean . Toileteries are left out every day for guests . Tea and coffee making facilities are also supplied which is a great bonus. The breakfasts are really good with a varied choice. The staff are , without exception , pleasant and helpful. The location is ideal for a choice of shops and pubs nearby and to an Underground station ( Earls Court ) which gives easy access to the city centre and all its innumerable and wonderful attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from the fire alarm going off without fire, reasonable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lanneNL
Reviews.Content: The BW Burns is located in a great neighbourhood, Earl's court, with lots of places to eat, drink or do grocery shopping. Only a 2 min walk to the tube from where it's a short ride to piccadilly circus, leicester square and major sightseeing stuff. The hotel itsels is in more quiet side street off Earls court road, facing a gardensquare. As with a lot of hotels in London (at least those I have viewed or experienced) rooms tend to be small....The first one we stayed was indeed, but it was clean, and beds were good. Minor points for the room: cold (the room had 2 outer walls which didn't were isolated very well, but after asking we got extra blankets and slept great and warm), and it could use some renovating, but no safety issues. Second room (because of snow our flight back home was cancelled and we could stay in the hotel for the extra night, but in a different room) was a bit less small, and warmer, so we probably were just a tad unlucky with the first one ;) First night there, the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, (and repeatedly 2 times more). To be clear: you can't sleep through it, it was loud enough. We gathered to the lobby, were the personnel assured us there was no fire....Didin't see any smoke either. After back to bad, an hour or 2 later, same again. Still no fire. It repeated for a 3rd time, same case. Personnel was friendly, but we were worried a bit that there would be a real fire and people would be thinking it was another false alarm again. During the day they fixed it. Service was okay, nothing too fancy but helpful. What we would have liked to see different, was that they would have left a note or something in our room the second day, to let us know the fire alarm issue was resolved. We had to ask for it now, but after all the inconvenience, a note from the hotel would have been ok. Breakfast: reasonable, with enough choice for a good start. There is a small garden/terrace at the back which would be good sitting in in summer I think. Small bar, looked okay. One computer with internet, some sites for free (travelrelated) and for other sites a coin machine. All in all: a very reasonable hotel in a great location, as long as you keep in mind that rooms can be small, as elsewhere in London!

Reviews.Title: “Cheery spacious room in a lovely neighborhood, great nearby pubs, & eateries”
Reviews.Author: nini8_11
Reviews.Content: Loved the friendly vibriant neighborhood, room was suprisingly spacious w/plenty of seating & a "plush" feel on street level overlooking a common garden area. The subway station was bright & safe, (very important for first time visitors). The staff was helpful finding a Mass, w/map included, in a brisk walking distance. Two of our favorite visits was Nando's for evening treat, & the bakery across from subway for delicious pasteries. The room itself was so quiet & comfortable, we overslept one morning, 2 hours! Quite lovely overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value, exactly what was expected”
Reviews.Author: DBSA42
Reviews.Content: As in most central London hotels, the single rooms were quite small but they were modern, comfortable and clean. The bathrooms had a full sized bath with a very efficient over-bath shower. Even the rooms facing the road were quiet. The full English breakfast was well worth paying the extra for; was cooked to order and good quality. The staff were extremely helpful. The location was great too, just a couple of minutes walk to the tube station and alsoEarls Court High St. with bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideJess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at Best Western Burns over New Years. When we arrived we discovered that our agent had booked us a tiny room with 2 single beds. We were expecting the small room but not the single beds! I phoned reception and within minutes she got back to me with a solution and was very nice and understanding about it all. For a small extra fee we were upgraded to a deluxe kingsize room which was huge, had an enormous bathroom and a floor-to-ceiling window with a view of the pretty street outside - we were so pleased! The location of this hotel is fantastic, Earls Court tube station is a short walk down the street so was very easy to get around the place (it's so true what everyone says about the London tube, within a few hours we had mastered it!). There are plenty of shops nearby including a Marks & Spencer right at the end of the street and a Sainsbury's further up. Also, lots of ATM's and a Post Office really close too. We had breakfast included which was very nice each morning and internet access was via a computer near the dining room at a cost of about 1 pound for 20mins. Use of the safe in our room was 2 pound per day. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but ...”
Reviews.Author: drjmpmd
Reviews.Content: This hotel could have gotten better reviews with a little effort: the food is very good; the rooms are clean; the location is very convenient. However it took them three days to NOT fix their WiFi access (they blamed my smart phone when even someone else was complaining); the room was also very badly insulated and therefore very cold (the corridor was warmer).

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location and good customer service”
Reviews.Author: djkeygr
Reviews.Content: Relatively small rooms and beds Good room service and level of cleanliness Nice view from the 4th floor to Barkston Gardens Average Breakfast (choose the English one) Very helpful and kind in the reception Great location (2mins from Earl's Court Station - Boots, M&S, Sainsbury's, several good restaurants and pubs really close to the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: ladiesthatlunch3
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not deserve its rating. We were greeted by a display of dead flowers in the entrance lobby, upon approaching the less than friendly male Receptionist we announced our name only to find that our booking could not be found, after a curt demand for our confirmation eventually a room in the basement was allocated (-1 in the lift) and we were directed toward the lift with a dismissive wave of the hand. No other information was given however, much ado was made of pointing out the non-smoking policy, we were both asked to sign a form acknowledging our understanding of this rule. The welcome, if one could call it that was almost name, rank and number! The room was located down a long corridor permeated by a disconcerting odour of damp, the standard of decoration and bathroom fittings was cheap and primitive. Due to the location of our room below ground, there was a constant rumble of tube trains under the floor and together with the cold damp atmosphere sleep was almost impossible. Searching for the information folder proved fruitless (there was'nt one) yet another saving I suppose however, I am sure this must breach Best Western criteria. We made the mistake of taking breakfast which again was budget throughout even down to the plastic table cloth. Staff at this hotel are robotic and do no appear happy in their work, on check-out the Receptionst failed to ask if we had enjoyed our stay, she probably new the answer!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: worldaviator
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Earls Court tube station, which we found very convenient. The young gentleman who checked us in needs customer service training, which set the tone of our stay here at the Burns. The room was near the elevator, and we could hear floor creaks from outside our door and above us. The wi-fi, although complimentary, was spotty and slow. The water pressure from our shower was HORRIBLE, and had to keep the pressure half-way to get any hot water! Our rate included the full English breakfast, and we thought it was great, especially the porridge. After we checked out, I hung around the lobby for a few minutes waiting for my partner who was in the loo, housekeeping actually returned a folder to the front desk I left in my room. I immediately told the front desk clerk that it was my folder in room 2xx and she gave it to me without hesitation. At least I can say that housekeeping is a bit honest, which is great to see. For 200 USD a night, we expected better. It's a good thing we were staying here for just 1 night. Overall, a mixed bag.

Reviews.Title: “We Love You, Best Western Burns”
Reviews.Author: B_Pope
Reviews.Content: We were blessed to receive two free nights at this hotel as part of a promo package from British Airways. Many thanks to the airline and the hotel staff for making our visit a great experience! Take the London Underground from Heathrow airport to the Earl’s Court station, and walk around the corner to the hotel. Enjoy the charming neighborhood, with its pubs and other businesses frequented by locals (which means good food at reasonable prices). The same Underground station will enable you to visit any part of London quickly and cheaply. (We took “the Tube” to Westminster Abbey, West End, and Royal Observatory in Greenwich). The hotel blends into the neighborhood, being part of a set of “row houses” on a quiet side street. Some travelers (notably Americans) would consider this hotel to be cramped, but we thought it was quirky in a good way, with a fun “nooks and crannies” floor plan. The décor is dated, which only adds to its charm. Elevators (excuse me, I mean lifts) are tiny, and halls are narrow. We were assigned a basement room with two single beds, and when we asked for a single-bed room for two, the friendly and helpful staff cheerfully upgraded us to a 3rd floor double at no extra charge. Our view was of the small park across the street. The room was 8 feet by 16, not including the bathroom and closet. There was some normal wear-and-tear to the room and fixtures, but nothing was shabby, and everything was tasteful and functional. If anything is in need of updating, it would be the single-pane windows, although the neighborhood was quiet enough that street noise was no real issue. Room amenities included a safe (for extra fee), water kettle with tea and (instant) coffee, hairdryer, and a pants press. The bathroom had a tub/shower with very good temperature, water pressure, and height; soap, shampoo, and shower cap. The room had no individual thermostat, but we found the temperature always to be just fine. On our first afternoon my wife was snoozing on the bed, and the maintenance man came around to check all the heat radiators on our floor. He displayed proper discretion by saying he would come back later rather than disturbing a sleeping customer—I was impressed. There is a pub in the basement, which also served as our breakfast room. Our package included full English breakfast, which included sausages and eggs made-to-order. We especially liked the porridge. We loved this hotel for its convenient location, welcoming neighborhood, and friendly and helpful staff. Make this hotel your home base when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable in a perfect location near Tube.”
Reviews.Author: Debmor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to go to a Classical Spectacular in the Royal Albert Hall . The hotel is really clean and the breakfast is great whether you have Continental or full . As with a lot of these hotels in the area the rooms are quite small but very adequate and spotlessly clean. Only 5 mins wlk o the Earl's Court tube station. Have been before and will certainly go again!!!! It was also busy which tells it's own story.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: angi1975
Reviews.Content: I've been in Burns hotel with my girlfriend and other friends. The location is very good, just 3 minutes walking from Earls Court station (piccadilly and district line), and the road in front the hotel is very quiet. We had just one problem with our first room, probably a water pipe collapsed and there was a waterfall in our room! But the boy at the reception managed very well the situation and we moved to another room that was a little bit bigger and in our opinion was better despite it was in the basement. The room was very clean and we had no problem with shower. The breakfast was ok, we had english breakfast but I did it just once because of all the hambugers I had the nights before :). Within a walking distance there are a lot of pubs and restaurants, and also a Marks & Spencer, and a pharmacy.

Reviews.Title: “Works great for me”
Reviews.Author: dreamerNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in June, overall it was great, for the price I paid and its good location, I am very happy with this hotel. - room: I booked a single room and got one on second floor, it's not small by London standard and has working high-speed internet. I woke up because of the smell of coffee from kitchen coming through the window(I didn't close it entirely), I personally liked it, it doesn't have a mini refrigerator in the room, so I had to buy some drinks from the supermarket around the corner, this is the only thing I can complain about the room. - bathroom: it's huge with a huge and deep bathtub, single room with a bathroom that has a bathtub, I didn't expect it, really nice! - breakfast: it's included in the price, and I was very satisfied, it's regular continental breakfast and I liked their coffee very much, there's a small garden area to sit there and enjoy breakfast. - staff: they are nice and friendly. - location: about 3 minutes from underground station, close to lots stores, since it's summer, I felt safe to walk on the street around 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “good location,teeny tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: ehp045
Reviews.Content: Very convienient to Earls Court station, nice neighborhood. For London, the room rate was decent. The hotel was under going some much needed renovation and updating. My major complaint was room size, very much like a inside cabin on a small cruiseliner. We had to choreograph our movements so we wouldn't bump into one another. The room was clean, small beds ok. The staff was friendly . This was a second choice to base2staywhich was fully booked(same area)

Reviews.Title: “All the basics are there”
Reviews.Author: FarahM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Burns Hotel for 5 nights when on a business trip to London. I wasn't quite sure how it would turn out after I read the trip advisor reviews, but I basically picked it because I wanted an affordable, clean, and convenient place to stay (in terms of location). I can say the hotel was up to my expectations. The hotel staff are firendly, the room wasn't very spacious but also not very small for a room in london. The cleaning lady was very friendly and efficient. The room was clean and overlooking Barkston Gardens. The hotel location is great, just a 2 min. walk from Earl's Courl's tube station (which you can use to get to all the shopping and touristic places), and just off Earl's court main street where you have many places to eat (Starbucks, Subway, Mcdonald's, Gourmet Burger Kitchen..etc). It's also a pretty crowded neighbourhood so you don't have to worry if you're coming back late at night. Good for a woman travelling on her own. One thing that was a little disappointing is the internet access. Although they do offer it, they were changing providers on one of the nights when I critically needed it. So I had to resume my work at Mcdonald's. Also I didn't enjoy the breakfast, so I used to grab a snack from M&S or starbucks around the corner. I also didn't know three star hotels didn't have bell boys, so I had a hard time taking my bags out! Nevertheless, I had an overall positive experience and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: sheilasmith33
Reviews.Content: arrived on the friday evening for a weekend treat for my birthday.hotel is round the corner from Earls court tube station and just of the high street.great location and the hotel staff were very friendly and pleasent. i was abit surprised when i got home and read the reviews as i thoght it was a great place to stay and would stay again as well. quite a few pubs on the high street and plenty of places to eat. went shopping down oxford street, football match at fulham and even went to see We will rock u the Queen musical so a fun packed weekend stopping in a pleasant hotel

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not again”
Reviews.Author: Grant_I_W
Reviews.Content: The good - Location The bad - the room size, we booked a 'cheap' double room and when we got there, we had no space to even open our 2 suite cases! We then complained and asked to be moved, we had to pay an upgrade cost to a Kingsize room at +£40 ! This negated the whole point of staying at this hotel. The okay - Breakfast, although a little plain was fine. The cleanliness, besides hair in the plug hole is the bath and shower all was okay. Courtyard was a little noisey at night. Grant

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: richmond223
Reviews.Content: Just home from 2 nights at the Best Western Burns Hotel. Do not be put off by negative reviews, I found the hotel to be clean, rooms of average size, towels changed daily and plenty of complimentary shower gel etc. Breakfast was served in a bright, spotless dining room and not at all cramped as stated in other reviews. Have stayed in London in 4* Hotel at twice the price and to be honest found very little difference. If I was returning I would probably choose the Burns Hotel over the 4* as I would prefer to have the extra money in my pocket to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good. Hotel is somewhat overpriced for what it offers.”
Reviews.Author: TravelDreamer22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at hotel Burns, Great Western twice and find the hotel 'alright', but overpriced for what it is offering. The location is great however; close to the Earl’s Court tube station and in an area that is nice to walk around to grab something to eat etc. On another hand, the rooms are small and there is poor insulation in the rooms so you can very easily hear the neighbours when they walk around, etc. The rooms were fairly clean, but old carpets and bathrooms that looks tired. They offered us free wireless internet access, however, our experience was that if you have a room too far away from the reception – you will not receive any signals. As we had a room on the top floor, we did not have any signals. You will then have to sit in the reception if you need internet. Lastly, the breakfast is if nothing else, simple but ok. You have to pay extra for a ‘full English breakfast’ and for the price we paid we were disappointed by what they offered. Overall, I would consider staying there again due to its location, but not because of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: vixx83
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, a 2 min walk from Earls Court tube, with access to the Picadilly and District lines. Also, there are loads of cafes and food places so you can grab a bite to eat near the hotel. The room was very small, though clean. I found the bed to be quite uncomfortable, and the hotel really needs air conditioning - we were boiling in our room at night, even with the window open. We had a drink at the bar and sat outside on the patio which is lovely. Reasonably priced drinks for central London too. Breakfast was a disapointment. Tables crammed together and surly, unhelpful staff who really looked like they would rather be elsewhere. We were not offered tea or coffee and could not catch the eye of anyone to get any. Enough to get you started for the day, but you certainely would not want to linger over a paper and a coffee. Overall, the hotel is fine and well located, but overpriced for what you get when you consider the amount of hotels on offer in London. You can get better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Snug room with free wifi”
Reviews.Author: luvtravellin82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Burns Hotel for 2 nights. Loved its location at Earls Court Tube, especially on the Piccadilly Line, that will take us straight from the hotel to the Heathrow Airport without any changing of trains. And the District Line that bring us to most of the places where the Piccadilly Line cannot bring us. The breakfast was continental, there was hard-boiled eggs, toast, bread, rolls, crossiants, ham, cheese, yoghurt, teas, coffee, juices, milk and cereals. Pay another 3GBP for English breakfast if you prefer. Had a small lift, which was probably a dumbwaiter for human, but served its purpose by ensuring that we don't have to climb up the stairs with our suitcases. (Thank god!) The twin room was small, ensuite with a bathtub and shower. Hairdryer was provided, so were coffee-making facilities. There was also a safe, and a electric trouser press too. Overall, the winner was the fact that there was free wifi provided, and it was high speed! I would definitely choose to stay there when I go to London again.

Reviews.Title: “Snug but tired”
Reviews.Author: nickwlondon
Reviews.Content: The Burns Hotel 18-26 Barkston Gardens Kensington SW5 0EN was a pretty cosy small terraced hotel in Earls Court. It is suffering from age and limited space but it is a small hotel. It was clean and warm and welcome. For the price it was good value but that may have been simply the time of the booking. I would recommend this hotel as a budget hotel for 75 pounds a night but no more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money, would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: WriterAnon
Reviews.Content: On first arriving I was very impressed by the hotel location. It is situated in a quiet little square, 2 minutes walk from the Tube station, and just off Earls court Road; where there are an abundance of shops, restaurants and bars. Check in was fast, and efficient, and my room although small was perfectly adequate for my needs. A bed, desk, wardrobe (with safe), a set of drawers and 2 small cabinets. The bathroom was compact but very clean and there was plenty of hot water no matter what time I showered. The style was slightly dated, even though the hotel has recently been refurbished, and the corridors are narrow and rambling but this only adds to the ambience of this charming hotel. The staff were always polite and helpful, no matter what the time of day or night, and you were made to feel valued as a guest. The continental breakfast on offer was excellent, and everything was fresh and replenished regularly. My only complaint is that the matress on my bed was old, and as a result it was very soft and lumpy, but that is my only complaint in four days at the hotel.
